text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. His brother Satoshi Kajino is also a former footballer. ==Biography== Kajino was born in Aichi Prefecture on July 11, 1960. After graduating from Tokyo University of Agriculture, he joined Japan Soccer League club Yanmar Diesel in 1983. The club won the 1983 and 1984 JSL Cup. From 1988, his brother Satoshi Kajino joined Yanmar and they played together. In 1992, he moved to J1 League club Gamba Osaka. In 1994, he moved to Japan Football League club Kashiwa Reysol. In 1994, the club won the 2nd place and was promoted to J1 League. He retired in 1995. On June 2, 1988, Kajino debuted for the Japan national team against China. In 1989, he played at 1990 World Cup qualification. He played 9 games and scored 1 goal for Japan until 1989. ==Club statistics== Club performance Club performance Club performance League League Cup Cup League Cup League Cup Total Total Season Club League Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Japan Japan Japan League League Emperor's Cup Emperor's Cup J.League Cup J.League Cup Total Total 1983 Yanmar Diesel JSL Division 1 15 0 15 0 1984 9 0 9 0 1985–86 20 0 20 0 1986–87 21 0 21 0 1987–88 22 3 2 0 24 3 1988–89 21 0 4 1 25 1 1989–90 21 0 2 0 23 0 1990–91 19 2 2 0 21 2 1991–92 JSL Division 2 26 2 1 0 27 2 1992 Gamba Osaka J1 League - 3 1 3 1 1993 23 0 1 0 6 0 30 0 1994 Kashiwa Reysol Football League 22 0 0 0 1 0 23 0 1995 J1 League 5 0 0 0 - 5 0 Total Total Total 224 7 1 0 21 2 246 9 ==National team statistics== Japan national team Japan national team Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1988 1 0 1989 8 1 Total 9 1 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Aichi Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:J1 League players Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Cerezo Osaka players Category:Gamba Osaka players Category:Kashiwa Reysol players
